Identification_Area.title: The Cometary and Interstellare Dust Analyzer for Stardust

Modification_Detail.description: Updated schema version. Adding missing "investigation" references.
Changed inst LIDs from u:n:p:c:i:instID.scID to u:n:p:c:i:scID.instID And per "Guide toPDS4 Context Products" v1.7, changed all lidvid_reference to lid_reference

External_Reference.reference_text: Kissel, J., A. Glasmachers, E. Grun, H. Henkel, H. Hofner, G. Haerendel, H. von Hoerner, K. Hornung, E.K. Jessberger, F.R. Krueger, D. Mohlmann, J.M. Greenberg, Y. Langevin, J. Silen, D. Brownlee, B.C. Clark, M.S. Hanner, F. Hoerz, S. Sandford, Z. Sekanina, P. Tsou, N.G. Utterback, M.E. Zolensky, and C. Heiss, Cometary and Interstellar Dust Analyzer for comet Wild 2, J. Geophys. Res., 108, (E10), 8114, 2003, doi:10.1029/2003JE002091.

Instrument.name: The Cometary and Interstellare Dust Analyzer for Stardust
Instrument.description: The Cometary and Interstellar Dust Analyzer (CIDA) was a fast time-of-flight mass spectrometer comprising a silver target, a single-stage ion reflector, and an open electron multiplier. It analyzed the composition of individual grains each particle impacted the silver target and was ionized. CIDA could measure masses ranging from 1 to a few thousand atomic mass units (amu), encompassing all elements in the periodic table plus many molecules, including organic compounds.
